title: Doppler - cars motion for higher observed freq

content.question: Two cars, Car <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and Car <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, are both on a straight road. Both cars are moving, but not necessarily in the same direction. The driver of Car <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> sounds the horn, which emits a periodic sound wave of rest frequency <math alttext="f sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. The driver of Car <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> observes a frequency greater than <math alttext="f sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> from Car <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>â€™s horn. Which of the following statements about the motion of the two cars is correct?

choices.label: The two cars could be moving in the same direction, with Car <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> behind and moving faster than Car <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>.

The two cars could be moving in the same direction, with Car <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> ahead of and moving faster than Car <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>.

The two cars could be moving in the same direction at the same speed, with Car <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> behind Car <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>.
The two cars could be moving in opposite directions away from each other.

content.answer: The two cars could be moving in the same direction, with Car <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> behind and moving faster than Car <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>.
